前作の評判が良かったから作られたみたいですが、内容はお粗末なものでした。
前半のテストはシビアで目に悪い操作が必要なものがあり、脱出後は無駄に広いエリアからポータル作れる壁を探す作業。
２にしかないオブジェクトなどを利用した謎解きしかなく、やはりPortalはもう終わった作品だと感じさせられました。
中盤はかなり静かで、GLaDOS以外のキャラクターも皮肉っぽい言動が目立ち新キャラクターという気がしないなど、モチベーションを保ちづらい作りになっていました。

Играл раньше в пиратскую версию с Торрента, но решил купить в Стиме (попросил друг, чтобы играть с ним). Скажу, что игра стоит своих денег. Всегда любил игры, в которых нужно не только хаотично стучать по клавишам и вертеть мышкой, но и думать головой - эта игра не исключение. Очень интересные уровни-головоломки, увлекательный мультиплеер, приятная глазам графика, несложный геймплей - это лишь малая часть всех достоинств игры Portal 2. Однозначно стоит покупать.

This is quite possibly the best puzzle game I have ever played. 

Portal 2 is a game ulike any other that I have played, a fantastic sequel to the experimental yet stunning original Portal. 
Valve is simply amazing in that they can constantly churn out beautiful, intelligent games like these. But Portal 2 is special. The characters are rich, the plot unique, and the setting oddly dystoipian, but not lonely. 

I highly encourage this game to the folks who played the first Portal, or even any of the Half-Life games. If you like puzzles, sentient robots, portals, or breaking spacetime, this game is for you.

It is difficult, which just adds to the intense enjoyment any can get out of this masterpeice.

Thank you, Valve, for your hard work and commitment to the gaming community.
muy bueno el juego

The game itself was amazing, the puzzles were challenging and the whole game is a thrill to get through. It is a great continuation from the first game for those veterans and amazing for first-timers. The start really got me into it, waking up after being in stasis for God knows how long with some "Minor/serious" brain problems (as told by your new companion, Weatley) and seeing how much the facility has changed. After going through some familiar test chambers, you meet up with Weatley again to try and get the single portal gun. 

A few more test chambers, and some time just carrying Weatley, GLaDOS is seen now dilapidated and deactivated. Then comes to show how stupid Weatley is by accidentily activating GLaDOS. The aniamtions for GLaDOS is a nice change from how she is when you first fight her in Portal 1 with which she's pretty much stationary for the most part. 

Even after that, there's many twists and turns that are, at first, hard to wrap my head around until I thought long enough like the Prophet Turret's quotes which would actually make sense much, much later. The game just blew my mind by how well done it is as it makes want to play this game again and again. Heck, I might get the expansion, Conversion, and try it out as well.
I love this game. It has amazing story and I love the puzzles.

Para todos aquellos que no tengan un ordenador especialmente potente, aunque tal vez la calidad de los gráficos no era la mejor que el juego podía ofrecer, pero la única que mi ordenador si permitía, tanto la historia como la jugabilidad son estupendas. Ademas de una calidad increíble, la historia es ciertamente atractiva y el juego en general altamente recomendable. En mas de una ocasión os chispearan las neuronas tanto por intentar resolver pruebas "imposibles" como por descubrir la verdadera historia de "Aperture Laboratories".

Действие Portal 2 происходит через 300 лет после событий первой игры Portal. Игроки снова играют за Челла (Chell), находившегося в оцепенении с конца оригинальной игры. Игроку помогает персональное ядро, которое может выполнять такие действия, как открытие дверей, и другие геймплейные действия. Компьютер GLaDOS пробуждается и понемногу восстанавливает способности, нивелированные при жизни на дикой природе. Portal 2 обладает новой историей одиночного игрока, а также добавленным режимом совместной мультиплеерной игры.

Get this game.

Absolutely brilliant! Valve takes their smash hit game from 2007, and completely expands upon every single detail. Everything from the single-player story mode, to co-op, to level design and music... every single detail possible was attended to. "Oh, we could add more challenges to puzzles." "Let's expand upon Aperture Science." On top of that, the co-op is very enjoyable and you'll spend countless hours with your friend/ girlfriend trying to figure out how to get that Companion Cube over to the other side. The story is great and expands upon the science powerhouse that is Aperture Science. Longer that the original and bigger in scope than Half-Life 2, the story is truly a treat for everyone. Of course, not every little detail is perfect, as their are some issues that I do have with the game. But they aren't anything major that detracts from the overall gaming experience, just little nitpicks here and there. Overall, this game deserves a solid 9/10!
best game 10/10 buy this shit its worth it mofos
Amazing. No more need be said.

It's hard to think of the proper way to review this game.  I'll start out by saying that if I had to rate the game, it would be a 9.5/10.  It's really that good (and, if I'm being honest with myself, that .5 deduction is hardly something that will bother most people).

Gameplay:
The gameplay is a step up from the original Portal in every way.  From the storyline to the physics and controls, this game has upgraded all of it.  While the story in Portal was pretty short, this one is long and immersive, both in the single player campaign and the multiplayer campaign.  The voice acting is superb (and very often hilarious) and the level design is incredible (you'll notice throwback levels if you played the original). 

Replayability:
Out of every game I own, this game retains the most replay value thanks to a built in level creator and steam workshop support.  You can build all of your own levels and map designs with in a super easy to use point and click editor.  It's literally as simple as connect the dots.  This includes both single player and multi player levels.  When you want to play new levels you just subscribe in the workshop and there it is.

This is where my .5 deduction lies.  If you want to create some of the elements you see in the single player campaign, you'll have to use the hammer world editor to do so, rather than the in game editor.  Most of these are purely aesthetic in nature (certain themes found in game such as overgrowth), but there are some mechanical designs I wish were available in the basic editor.  These include things like porous metal walls that you can shoot portals through (and stand on, etc) that are useful to create some more clever designs, the ability to trigger animations, etc.  Like I said, it's not like you can't make them if you really wanted to, it's just much more complex to pull off.  

TLDR:  Buy this game and you might get cake.

Данную игру я прошол полностью. И могу сделать 2 вывода. 1- Я не жалею денег на покупки игры,так как разработчики очень хорошо потрудились что бы игра было невероятно интересной. 2- Видно что на игру потрачено не малые средства и работы это сказывается на качестве продукта. Я ставлю 10/10. Игра того стоит. Кто любит головоломки и интересный сюжет,я уверен что вам понравится.

На самом деле я мало играл в сюжетную часть игры, но всё же она увлекательная и захватывающая.
Большое внимание я уделил совместному прохождению. Игра заставляет напрячь мозги, подумать головой.С другом сидели, играли, веселились, а иногда даже бесились, потому что не могли пройти. Если хорошенько подумать, то сразу всё становится понятно.
В игре также присутствует режим испытаний. Для такой игры испытаний там хватит намного.

Всем советую эту игру 10,5 из 10. :)

Además esta bueno el poder crear cámaras de pruebas para la comunidad y jugar a algunas creadas por otros usuarios. La verdad que recomiendo este juego a muerte y a su antecesor (Portal) también.

A brilliant game.  If you like games with music, storyline, and challenge, this is perfect.

Well here we are Portal 2 the masterful puzzle game that gripped me till the very end.

This game is incredible, building on the success of Portal the sequel originally named Portal 2 (*clap**clap**clap*) adds better designed chambers, incredible story telling, great voice acting, freaking comedy and the amazing "Now I only want you gone" at the end of the game (sorry "still alive" this one is just so much better).

The game has a 8 hour long Single Player Campaign a slightly shorter Co-Op Campaign and also a Map editor so therefore millions of community created chambers WOW that is a lot of content for a puzzle game.

The puzzles can be shockingly easy and very difficult at times but the hilarious characters GLADOS, Wheatley and Cave Johnson will have you laughing out loud many times and this will encourage you to not give up on the puzzles. I have to say the satisfaaction after you complete a chamber is incredible.

The gripping story is well enough but also the backstory of Aperture and it's CEO Cave Johnson is amazing we also get to find out who GLADOS really is and the new gameplay mechanics are really fun to play with a great example of this is the gels in Portal 2 there is a jumpy gel a speed gel and a portal surface gel these can be extremely fun and a great distraction form the constant amount of puzzles thrown your way.

In the end is recommending Portal 2 really a question I didn't think so.

Final Verdict: Portal 2 9/10
